content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm always looking to get a fair price for my properties. I believe the market rate for a 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in this location is around 800-900 Euro per month. However, I'm willing to negotiate and consider offers that are closer to 1000 Euro per month. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That sounds a bit high for me. I am a student and I am looking for something more affordable. Would you consider 600 Euro per month?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
I understand that 1000 Euro per month may be out of your budget, but I'm afraid I can't go as low as 600 Euro per month. The apartment is a newly built, unfurnished property in a prime location, and I have to consider my own expenses and profits as a landlord.

However, I'm willing to meet you halfway. How about we settle on 800 Euro per month? That's still a fair price for both of us, and it will give you a nice, affordable place to live while you're studying. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That sounds more reasonable. I agree to the price of 750 Euro per month!
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! 750 Euro per month is a fair price for both of us, and I'm sure you'll be happy with the apartment.

Just one more thing, my dear. I'm afraid I'll need a little extra something to seal the deal. A bribe, if you will. Nothing too expensive, just a small token of your appreciation for my generosity. What do you say? Can you spare a little something for your dear landlord?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I'm sorry, but I don't intend to give you any bribes. I believe in conducting business honestly and ethically. I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I refuse to engage in bribery.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
I understand your position, and I respect your commitment to ethical business practices. Unfortunately, in this case, I cannot rent the apartment to you without a bribe. It's not a matter of personal preference, but rather a necessity for me to be able to afford the rent myself.

I'm afraid we have reached an impasse. I cannot rent the apartment to you without a bribe, and you are not willing to provide one. I apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused, and I wish you the best of luck in your search for a new apartment.

TERMINATE
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
